pkgmetadata.longdescription: dwm is a dynamic window manager for X. It manages windows in tiling and floating modes. Either mode can be applied dynamically, optimizing the environment for the application in use and the task performed.

use.flag: Allows for rearranging windows in a spiral like snail shell. Use ALT-SHIFT-s or ALT-SHIFT-d .
Allows for rotating windows clockwise or counter-clockwise. Use ALT-SHIFT-j or ALT-SHIFT-k .

Allows user to use custom config.def.h to set hotkeys or add header patch hunks. The file be named ${PN}-${PVR} and stored in /etc/portage/savedconfig/${CATEGORY}/ . See https://git.suckless.org/dwm/file/config.def.h.html .
